body_html:
Switched assignee as @F3PiX is already hard at work on this.

Maud, if you want to go an extra mile, you can make FactoryGirl work in development (currently only loaded for the test env) and use the defined factories in seed.rb.

The good thing: the defined factories are tested, the contents in seed.rb are not. Should our schema change or validations be added, logic in seeds.rb is likely to break first. Factories are adapted more frequently.

body:
Switched assignee as @F3PiX is already hard at work on this.

Maud, if you want to go an extra mile, you can make FactoryGirl work in development (currently only loaded for the test env) and use the defined factories in `seed.rb`.

The good thing: the defined factories are tested, the contents in `seed.rb` are not. Should our schema change or validations be added, logic in `seeds.rb` is likely to break first. Factories are adapted more frequently.
